column2: May we be blessed by Annam's chosen.

Amidst the jotunbrud, Runecasters wield awesome power. Legends speak of great sages opening the very rainbow gates to Ysgard, others destroying steel with but a touch. The powers of the Runecaster are great indeed, but to convince these nomadic wanderers will take much gold and honor.
I already have a plan for them.

My Lord, a Runecaster has arrived at last. They have not yet demonstrated some of their mighty power, but already the tribe is asking for celebrations and feasts. Let us pray to Annam that this giant is as they says they are...
This character is exclusively attracted to those of the same gender.
This character does not have a strong gender preference in sexual and romantic matters.
This character does not conform closely to conventional ideas of their gender.
This character has been joined to a family through adoption, instead of being born to it. It is more difficult for them to prove themselves legitimate compared to a character born into a family.
This character has been there and back again. Their life of adventure is behind them.
This child resembles its family ó but the subtle differences will determine how others respond to [GetHerHis] appearance.
One can only hope for the best.
As this child begins to feed and grow, you begin to see indications of [GetHerHis] future physical strength and stamina.
May [GetSheHe] become as fit and vigorous as the heroes of old!
As this child interacts with the world, you learn whether or not [GetSheHe] takes after [GetHerHis] parents in mental ability.
Pray [GetSheHe] has learned from [GetHerHis] family even while in the womb

News arrives of a great threat - in the Stonelands, to the north of Cormyr, a sworn foe of the Obarskyr dynasty has been freed from her ancient prison. Once an elf named Lorelei Alavara, she has sworn vengeance against the Obarskyrs, and taken the form of a Red Dragon, Nalavarauthatoryl. Now she raises an army of goblins and orcs, with invasion likely only days away.
This bodes ill for the kingdom...
The Flaming Fist was founded by Grand Duke Eltan of Baldur's Gate. It's time they return to their roots.
The Flaming Fist has agreed to swear fealty to [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. They will now serve the [Root.PrimaryTitle].
Nezramites are the descendants of the legendary Mulhorandi wizard Nezram the World-Walker, who left for the planes in centuries past, but is said to visit the Realms on occasion.

Respect is a value based on the Prestige of a Patrician, determining how likely they will be elected Doge. It can be increased by investing money in the Campaign Fund, but children can never be elected.

ßY$HEIR$ß! is widely expected to succeed ßY$RULER$ß!. However, there is always a degree of uncertainty in the elections. \nIn most cases, the reigning leader of the republic is represented by a dynast in the election, ßY$who hands over the seat$ß! upon victory.
The once  a twelve-year elections are coming up a year from now, and this will be your last chance to influence the outcome in your favour.
[target_new_doge.GetDynName] has been elected the new [target_new_doge.GetTitle] of the Great Republic of [target_republic.GetBaseName].

column2: The elections have been postponed to next year due to strife between the leaders of the republic.
Combat Modifier boost to War Mammoth troops: $PERC$
Combat Modifier boost to Bestial Allies: $PERC$
Combat Modifier boost to War Priests

The signs at first were subtle. Friends came easy to you, from obnoxious bullies, to even the most feral dog. And as you got older, you could fix broken plates and torn shoes. There was something peculiar about your childhood, though you truly didn't know why. That is until with but the slightest brush of your hand, lightning came forth. You are a sorcerer, born into magic that mere humans spend decades trying to master. How and why you got this power is a mystery, only you may solve.

Your precious child has always been a bit different. Falling into muddy pools, and emerging cleaner than ever, to chasing seemingly intangible lights that came from nowhere. But there can be no denying, when with a flick of their wrist, magical power erupted forth, that they are a sorcerer. How did they gain such awesome power, is perhaps a secret for the ages. Did your ancestors mingle with things foul or fair, perhaps even beyond? Regardless, your child has proven themselves powerful, and a future of good or evil must surely be decided upon.
This siege is taking up valuable time and resources. What should we do?
As an arcane caster class of sufficient level, you are able to toss out arcane (or unholy) balls of fire at the wall defenders, reducing their numbers.
As a stealth-oriented class of sufficient level, you are able to send in spies under the cover of night and sow discontent in the enemy ranks, lowering their morale.
Some bloody idiot is tossing fireballs at the ramparts. Some of our men have been killed in the blasts.
Rumors about our food stocks have been spreading around the men. The rumors have likely been started by a spy in our midst, but the damage has already been done.
This is a hidden trait. How are you even seeing this? Cheater.
Horus, who would later become Horus-Re, is the mulhorandi god of life, kings, rulership, the sun and vengeance and has ruled Mulhorand for millenia through his mortal incarnations.

Some commanders are so devoted to [Root.GaragosLoc] that they see warfare as simply mass-scale slaughter in offering to their god. They yearn for a mass melee in which the lines blur and it's kill or be killed.
